snippet: Hachette has abandoned private offices in favor of open-plan cubicles, a trend that has migrated from tech start-ups to even city governments.
abstract: Hachette Book Group becomes first major American publishing house to abandon private offices altogether in favor of open-plan cubicles, trend that has migrated from tech start-ups to advertising agencies, architecture firms and even city governments; Hachette's chief executive Michael Pietsch says open plan takes some getting used to, but he believes company will benefit from having its senior leaders out in the mix with rest of staff.
lead_paragraph: Hachette has abandoned private offices in favor of open-plan cubicles, a trend that has migrated from tech start-ups to even city governments.

headline.main: Cubicles Rise in a Brave New World of Publishing
headline.print_headline: Cubicles Rise in Brave New World of Publishing
